intro: Tillaea minuta, commonly known as the dwarf saxifrage, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces tiny, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Tillaea minuta is often found in tundra and mountainous areas where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
